intro: Echinolaena scabra var. ciliata, commonly known as the hairy roughhairs, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy texture and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a resilient species in arid environments.
